page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content:
This area , between the{Malvern {Hills}and the{River Severn}is largely flat well drained dairy land with some arable and deciduous woodland.The only residential settlements are{Hall Green on the Eastern outskirts of{Great {Malvern , Guarlford Village}and the Northern parts of{Hanley Swan.
Originally part of{Malvern Chase,}much of the land was formerly owned by one of the large estates:the Foley estate to the North West ,the Beauchamp from Madresfield in the North , the Earl of Coventry's Estate on the East , Lechmeres of Severn End in the South East and the Hornyold estate of Blackmore Park in the South West.Most of the buildings are isolated farms or former farms and cottages.Reflecting the Malvern Hills District as{tourist { attraction},there are two caravan
